results.title: Physicists for industry
results.creator_credit: Trafford Price, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology and John Garrity
results.brief_description: Promotes the various course of options in Applied Physics for prospective students. It emphasizes the practical project work involved and the fields of industry open to graduates. Such as the interior design for the acoustics at the Melbourne Concert Hall etc.

results.title: Physical sciences: mountain building
results.creator_credit: Carey Crones and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: By using animation and models, various events in geological history are re-enacted. The film opens by giving a survey of the evidence scientists have for such interpretations of geological history as are given in this film, and, in the last sequences, mention is made of the importance to engineers and metallurgists of the scientist’s ability to interpret past geological history.

results.title: Physical preparation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pele: the master and his method”.
Stresses the importance of physical fitness in enabling players to give their best. Shows warm-up exercises and describes in detail the circuit training methods, used by the Brazilian team in which players move from station to station performing different exercises in sequence.

group.title: Pele: the master and his method

results.title: Physical growth and motor development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
Between the ages of 2-6, two major developments occur. Children learn to co-ordinate their body movements and to function independently in basic living skills such as eating and dressing. Physiological development displays a greater spectrum of individuality but generally the stomach doubles in size, although appetite is often reduced, the brain grows and the immune system develops. Muscle strength is related to maturation, however at this stage there is minimal difference between genders in motor performance. In this stage of development, children learn to explore concepts such as depth, size, height and develop spatial awareness.

results.title: Physical growth and motor development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Emphasises individual differences by depicting a wide range of normal physical growth and motor development. Discusses ways in which environmental factors such as nutrition and the mother’s health habits during pregnancy affect development. Traces developmental patterns and norms by examining the role of crawling in simultaneously developing both parts of the brain and the sequences of development across cultures and between genders.

results.title: Physical fitness and good health
results.creator_credit: Ken Peterson, Walt Disney Productions and Les Clark
results.brief_description: Uses animation to hows how exercise helps build muscle tissue and increase the capillaries’ capacity to supply blood to body parts; presents live action sequences of animals to show that rest is essential to all forms of animal life; discusses the importance of a proper diet for physical fitness and good health.

results.title: Physical fitness (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Animation and the singing of light hearted lyrics contrasts the lack of physical activity since machinery has become such a large part of modern life, against the amount of physical activity that was necessary before the event of such machinery. “We have a different style. But we don’t get enough exercise” are part of the lyrics which introduce this program. However, the video ends on a positive and hopeful note, as mankind is re-educated in the improvements possible to ensure health, happiness and quality of life by increasing daily physical activities.
